document.masterDocTitle: A review of the Cetoniinae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) from Argentina and adjacent countries: systematics and geographic distributions

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Gymnetis cornifrons Gory & Percheron, 1833: 330
(description), plate 65, Fig. 3 .

Allorhina cornifrons (Gory & Percheron)
:

(catalog; distribution);

(catalog; distribution);

(catalog; distribution).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution:
ARGENTINA
: Misiones : Alto Paraná ( Bruch 1911a );
Tucumán
( Bruch 1911a );
Chaco (?)
: “Chaco austral” (
Bruch 1911 a, Blackwelder 1944
).
URUGUAY
( Blackwelder 1944 ):
Montevideo
: Montevideo [ type locality] ( Gory & Percheron 1833 , Krajčík 1998 ).

Note : In view of its distribution (Paranaense Forests of the Amazonian Dominion, and one old record in Tucumán), the type locality may be erroneous. This species was never found along gallery forests, southwards from the humid forests in eastern Paraguay , the province of Misiones and north of Corrientes .
